claim: As of April 4, 2019, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reported that there are individual cases of measles confirmed in 15 states, resulting in a total of 465 reported cases as compared to 372 in 2018 (Figure 1) [3-4].
title: Figure 1. A bar graph from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website showing the number of measles cases from 2010 to April 4, 2019.

claim:
Results
A total number of nine peer-reviewed articles were used to address anti-vaccine sentiment and vaccine hesitancy (Figure 2).
title: Figure 2. A PRISMA 2009 flow diagram depicting the number of studies included in the qualitative synthesis using the mentioned inclusion and exclusion criteria.
